channel.title: About on Danielkvist, Front-End Developer
channel.description: Recent content in About on Danielkvist, Front-End Developer

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Tania Tania is a simple and clean theme for Hugo, the framework for building static websites. Even though it’s still on development you can see it working right here, as it is the current theme I am using for my webpage. It doesn’t use any CSS framework like Bootstrap or Bulma since the goal is to create a theme as light as possible. Only basics CSS properties like CSS Grid and CSS Flexbox.

item.title: Education
item.description: Education As a self-taught developer most of my education is based on Moocs, online courses, books and tutorials. Moocs I have successfully completed MOOCs such as CS50’s - Introduction to Computer Science and CS50’s - Web Programming with Python and JavaScript and audited others like W3Cx - Introduction to Web Accessibility or CS50’s - Mobile App Development with React Native. Mentioning only the most recents. Courses I have taken courses on platforms such as freeCodeCamp, Pluralsight, Frontend Master or Udemy about subjects like modern JavaScript, React, Golang, TDD, gRPC, Microservices, PostgreSQL, API design and Docker.
